title: Riot fix report system.
body: Riot you need to step back and look at what your doing with your report system. Its making a bunch of whiney self entitled people who do whatever they want during a game ruining it for everyone else in the game. if your going to have "roles" for a game then they need to be strictly enforced. First off sorry i can say what i want when i want if you don't like it then no need to be around me. Honestly i wouldn't mind a system where people can "block" you and never have you in a game again. Second they are mean in korea everyone on the team will tell you what you did wrong when you did it and they surrender when they need to. None of this never give up stuff that makes the game worse. its a matter of fact most games when a team gets ahead its over. i dont have a team of 4 faker and 1 imacutiepie every game. and most people probably dont want a 40 minute long grind fest every time they play 20 to 30 minutes at most. surrender needs to be changed to 3 votes being enough AND if surrender is put up in a game 5 times then the other should be allowed to leave with no penalty. i can understand if the guy dies once at 5 and doesn't come back but there no reason to keep 3 to 2 people in a game they know they are losing but the rest wont surrender. until they changes are made your game will lose lots and lots of player to other games. This can be fixed really quickly and make the overall game more enjoyable for all.

Freedom of Speech not only doesn't apply to privately owned businesses such as Riot Games, it also does not mean freedom of speech consequences. This means that you can still be held accountable for your actions and words. From [Ulanopo's Knowledge Base](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4086541&page=1#post43465469): 

>**Freedom of Speech!!!!!**

>Doesnt apply. No really. If were talking about American law, the First Amendment only applies to the government making laws that prohibit speech and, even then, freedom of speech isnt absolute. For example, you cant incite a riot, plan to kill the president or yell fire in a crowded theater.

>Also, theres nothing in the First Amendment that protects you from the consequences of your speech. People are fired all the time for making derogatory comments about their employer. My workplace, for example, has a social media policy that says that I can be terminated for badmouthing the company. They dont ask for passwords and access as some companies have been known to do, but it wouldnt be all that difficult to find me on the internet, knowing my real name, phone number and address.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackenedScar,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=94X3A6EK,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-07-09T20:57:17.032+0000)
>
> its called freedom of speech one of the most basic human rights this is why they have blocking and censor stuff in the first place no reason for it to be a rule when there are systems already in place.

Actually it is not.
Assuming you mean it as defined in the first amendment to the united states constitution:

_Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the government for a redress of grievances._

It prevents the government from silencing the press (seems familiar) or the public, or from preventing peaceful protest. 

It does not apply to private businesses, it does not protect speech that threatens of condones violence or hate.

TL;DR riot can erase your crying whenever they want, go back to your TD circlejerk. If you want to flex your patriotic dick, get on twitter and screech at your representative to punish the evil facist riot for deleting your cryposts.

Oh where to start where to start.....

First off, have you taken an english class and know how to space between thoughts? I just about got a headache reading that.

Second, if you want to say what you want, when you want, and you dont care how it comes off.... go ahead and tell your boss exactly what you think of them without any thought in how to say it or what to say. Hope you only have good things to say or that the boss finds it a good thing.

Third, just because you say what you did wrong and when.... does not make you a jerk and get you reported and everything else. If thats ALL you do, then that is generally fine, aslong as you dont mind when people do the same to you. However when you start adding in stuff like "yo re..... dont f-ing go without help you moron." That is where you start getting into trouble. "Hey, dont go alone" that works just fine and takes less of your time than adding in all those extra words that is 100% unneeded and unwanted.

Third i tend to not get to mean unless its something thats common sense like starting a 2 vs 5 under the enemy tower or if i ping 10 times not to go in or that my lane is missing and 1 minute later they die by exactly what i was pinging. yeah im going to be like "wtf man i told you like 6 times to back up or danger" then they usually do something rude or start feeding. What do you mean strictly enforced roles? For draft pick games where you are assigned a role, it is punishable to forcefully take another role from someone. If you mean blind pick, there are no assigned roles.

Korea is also more serious about esport games and as a result, you are likely to have less "casual" players. They most likely also actually give tips and feedback that is constructive. E.g "get x for y." as opposed to NA "omg quit feeding. Die less."

As for the surrendering, tell me, have you ever heard of internet cafes?  Not something we really have here. But in Korea and some other places, they are common and you have to pay for computer time. So as a result, they want to get as many games in as possible. While here I can play an hour long game and not feel like $z amount of money got wasted.

They are already working on stuff involving surrender votes though? Until then though, nah, you wanna leave? Leave, but deal with not being able to queue until match is over and a leaverbuster strike.

i see people do it all the time get stuck in a role they dont want so they feed by "playing" in the enemy jungle or fighting over and over in lane so they die.
